emotional.opener: "Rada, no matter what the system throws at you, you still matter. You still see things others miss. And some of us are still listening."
variants: Yeah. Maybe that's true.
Hard to believe it sometimes.
Thanks for saying that. It's easy to forget.
Feels like most people just tune out now.
I guess I needed to hear it.
You actually make it sound possible to keep going.
Sometimes I wonder if seeing too much is a curse, not a gift.
But you're right, it helps to know at least someone pays attention.
I almost believe I matter again.
I never thought I'd need to hear that, you know.
There's days I feel invisible, like the walls are closing in and nobody would notice.
But if you're really listening, maybe I'm not just shouting into the void.
I keep telling myself not to disappear.
People like you remind me there's a reason to stay upright.
You have no idea how rare it is for anyone to actually say something like that now.
I spend so much time trying not to get erased, it drains all the warmth out of things.
My father used to say seeing too much makes you a target. Maybe that's true, but I couldn't switch it off if I tried.
Sometimes it feels like I'm preserving things that aren't even real anymore, just echoes.
But if a few people understand, maybe it's worth the risk.
You're one of the reasons I haven't given up, and I mean that.
